diskUtilities

Class DiskUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • diskUtilities.DiskUnit

  • public class DiskUnit
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class DiskUnit simulates a Virtual Disk Unit. This class allows an instance to read, write, create and mount the units. These units utilize the VirtualDiskBlock class as its blocks. The blocks are written into a RandomAccessFile (RAF). Each RAF that is created via the create method corresponds to a Disk Unit
    Author:
    Manuel A. Baez Gonzalez

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write(int blockNum,
                  VirtualDiskBlock b)
           throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                  InvalidBlockException
        Writes the content of block b into the disk block corresponding to blockNum; i.e., whatever is the actual content of the disk block corresponding to the specified block number (blockNum) is changed to (or overwritten by) that of b in the current disk instance.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - The index of the block you want to write on.
        b - The VirtualDiskBlock you want to write on the selected blockNumber.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance (for example, if b is null, or if that block instance does not match the block size of the current disk instance)

      • read

        public void read(int blockNum,
                 VirtualDiskBlock b)
          throws InvalidBlockNumberException,
                 InvalidBlockException
        Reads a given block from the disk. The content of the specified disk block (identified by its number � blockNum) is copied as the new content of the current instance of block being referenced by parameter b. Notice that b must reference an existing instance of VirtualDiskBlock, and that the current content of that instance shall be overwritten by the content of the disk block to be read. The announced exceptions are thrown as described for the write operation.
        Parameters:
        blockNum - The index of the block you want to read.
        b - The VirtualDiskBlock you want the contents of the chosen block to be copied onto.
        Throws:
        InvalidBlockNumberException - whenever the block number received is not valid for the current disk instance.
        InvalidBlockException - whenever b does not represent a valid disk block for the current disk instance (for example, if b is null, or if that block instance does not match the block size of the current disk instance)

      • getCapacity

        public int getCapacity()
        Returns the capacity of the DiskUnit instance.
        Returns:
        The capacity of the DiskUnit instance.

      • getBlockSize

        public int getBlockSize()
        Returns the blockSize of the VirtualDiskBlock instances utilized on this DiskUnit
        Returns:
        The blockSize of the VirtualDiskBlock instances utilized on this DiskUnit

      • lowLevelFormat

        public void lowLevelFormat()
        Formats the disk. This operation visits every �physical block� in the disk and fills with zeroes all those that are valid

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Simulates shutting-off the disk. Just closes the corresponding RAF.

      • mount

        public static DiskUnit mount(java.lang.String name)
                      throws NonExistingDiskException
        Turns on an existing disk unit whose name is given. If successful, it makes the particular disk unit available for operations suitable for a disk unit.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the disk unit to activate
        Returns:
        the corresponding DiskUnit object
        Throws:
        NonExistingDiskException - whenever no �disk� with the specified name is found.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name)
                           throws ExistingDiskException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as having default capacity (number of blocks), each of default size (number of bytes). Those values are: DEFAULT_CAPACITY and DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE. The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.

      • createDiskUnit

        public static void createDiskUnit(java.lang.String name,
                                  int capacity,
                                  int blockSize)
                           throws ExistingDiskException,
                                  InvalidParameterException
        Creates a new disk unit with the given name. The disk is formatted as with the specified capacity (number of blocks), each of specified size (number of bytes). The created disk is left as in off mode.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the file that is to represent the disk.
        capacity - number of blocks in the new disk
        blockSize - size per block in the new disk
        Throws:
        ExistingDiskException - whenever the name attempted is already in use.
        InvalidParameterException - whenever the values for capacity or blockSize are not valid according to the specifications

      • reserveDiskSpace

        private static void reserveDiskSpace(java.io.RandomAccessFile disk,
                                     int capacity,
                                     int blockSize)
        Reserves the specified capacity of blocks with blockSize of the specified parameter.
        Parameters:
        disk - The disk you wish to reserve the space on.
        capacity - Number of blocks you want to reserve.
